children.value: Note Contextual Search is available on current Business and Digital Operations plans. Please contact our Sales Team if you would like to upgrade to a plan featuring Contextual Search.

Tags should be created for each object category (i.e. teams, escalation policies and users) that you would like them applied to, as they are siloed separately and do not transfer. For example, if you add a “Payments” tag to a team, this will not appear as an escalation policy tag, and it will not transfer to any individual user on that team. If you would like a “Payments” tag available for all objects, you will need to add it to a team, escalation policy and a user.
can create and delete tags by default. Global Admins and Account Owners can also opt to allow Managers to create tags by navigating to
Team Managers can create new tags (in addition to Account Owner and Global Admins)
and Manager, Global Admin and Account Owner
can add existing tags to objects. If your base role is lower but you have a Manager
, you will only be able to add tags to your team, its escalation policies and its users.
If you're not sure what role you have, or if you need your permissions adjusted, visit our sections on

screen, enter the tag name or browse tags in the Choose tags field. This will filter escalation policies, users and escalation levels that have this tag applied. Select your desired escalation policy, user or escalation level and then click
Can a space be added to a tag?
No, adding a space creates the tag with whatever you have typed to that point. You may use a hyphen or an underscore to replace spaces.
